result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: EZ. Defendant Angus William Edward Wright in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. (Jefferson Co. 22CT504; 22CT512)  Defendant states completed Impact and needs a driver's safety plan and likely to take 4 months to obtain license.  State does not oppose lengthy adjournment.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 15, 2023 at 01:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 15, 2023 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Angus William Edward Wright in court. Defendant requests adjournment to reinstate driver's license (has not yet completed AODA assessment since needs to obtain funds to pay for the assessment/class). Def waives right to attorney.
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Angus William Edward Wright in court.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Not guilty plea entered by Court.  Court orders $150.00 signature bond.  Defendant needs to obtain SR22 and assessment to obtain license and thinks will take about one year.
Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Initial appearance on May 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.
